_header: I saw a sweet seemly sight
_description: The Virgin’s Lullaby — one 6-line stanza (aabccb) and 5-line burden: ‘Lullay lullow lully lullay / Bewy bewy lully lully / Bewy lully lullow lully / Lullay baw baw my barne / Slepe softly now’

BLAdd5666.Transcription:
I saw a swete semly syghtA blisfujl birde a blossum brightThat
                    murnyng made & mirth of mangeA maydin moder mek & myldIn
                    credil kep a knaue childThat softly slepe scho sat & sange
BLAdd5666.Note:
Written twice, once for each voice. The manuscript is in the handwriting
                    of Friar John Brackley (f. 1v)
